meanings.definition: To surpass in thinking or intelligence.
meanings.sent1: She outthought her opponent in the chess game.
meanings.sent2: The detective outthought the criminal and solved the case.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox outthought the hunter by leading him in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her strategic mind outthought any challenge that came her way.
meanings.sent5: He outthought his competitors with his innovative ideas.

meanings.definition: To outwit or outsmart someone through superior thinking.
meanings.sent1: The student outthought his classmates in the math competition.
meanings.sent2: The hacker outthought the security system and gained access to the database.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon outthought the campers and stole their snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her quick wit always allowed her to outthink any opponent.
meanings.sent5: The mastermind criminal outthought the police at every turn.
